description.narrative: Developpement ecologique durable, creation demplois et damelioration des conditions de vie en milieu rural

activity-description.narrative: Le but du projet est de tester et vulgariser un modèle dEcovillages répondant aux besoins des populations et bénéfique en termes de conservation de la biodiversité et de développement faiblement émissif en carbone. A cet titre, de modèle dEcovillages ont été développés dans la région de Kédougou e

Improved governance framework and capacity for the effective incorporation of biodiversity conservation and low carbon adaptive development into the National Ecovillage Strategy

5 Improved competence levels and standards of the institutions responsible for EVs ANEV DPN DEF GENSEN measured by increased scores of the Capacity Development Scorecard
Average scores for all thematic areas 1 to 5 see below and levels of capacity systemic institutional and individual for both PA management and energy efficiency market transformation
Refer to PRODOC Annex 3 for a list of Capacity thematic areas and baseline scores

comment.narrative:
Average scores for all thematic areas and capacity levels of capacity for both PA management and energy efficiency market transformation
ANEV 62
DEFC 66
GENSEN 76
DPN 65
see PRODOC Annex 3 for a complete and disaggregated analysis
Average scores for all thematic areas and levels of capacity for both PA management and energy efficiency market transformation increase by at least 10 for each of the target institutions

Results for all thematic areas and capacity levels for Protect Areas management and market transformation of energy efficiency increased by at least 5 for each of the target institutions such as ANEV DEFCS GENSEN DPN
Furthermore 30 training sessions were held from June 2014 to June 2015 in all core Ecovillages ie a minimum of 3 sessions of technical training in the Ecovillage Center benefitting 952 people

description.narrative: Integrated land use natural resource management and biodiversity conservation provide social benefits in pilot Ecovillages and contribute to global BD benefits in CNRs and adjacent PAs
7 New Ecological Perimeters established and providing village needs through sustainable management wood fuel timber endemic species for CNR rehabilitation medicinal plants bamboo

comment.narrative:
7a Nationally only
4 or 5 EPs existed in 2009 the concept is quite new
7b Among project sites
2 established in project villages with up to 50ha

At least 200 ha of new EPs under sustainable management in all 10 villages
Text for the target had been accidently removed from 2013 PIR due to a pasting mistake We add it back now

Within 10 Ecological perimeters was taken to a double vegetable cropping over a total area of nearly 70 ha
Added to this is the introduction of 6 storage magazine and improve vegetable cropping Which has generated nearly 25 million FCFA year or nearly 120000 FCFA household
In addition we report that
98 microprojects aiming at intensification of production income generation are financed
40 ha of village woodlands are now established
150 eq ha of fruit trees
one ecotourism camping in lompoul
three fish ponds in Thiasky and one fish farm in Ndigue
6 Agro food processing units
10 artisanal saponification units
10 artisanal bakery units

At least 200 ha of new EPs under sustainable management in all 10 villages

description.narrative: 6 New CNRs 2 extensions of existing CNRs 4 and existing CNRs 2 functioning to conserve global biodiversity within their boundaries and in adjacent PAs

comment.narrative:
Nationally
21 CNRs 27 UPs total 441000 ha designated
Among project sites
6 CNRs tallying 147013 ha
See Table B in Section One of the METT for a nonexhaustive list of Community Natural Reserve and Pastoral Units in Annex 2

Among project sites at least 15000 ha of new and extended Community Nature Reserves established and functioning to conserve biodiversity increasing total conservation area targeted by the project to 162813 ha
Evidence of effective management is provided by increases in METT scores for all CNRs

Among the sites of the project at least 28875 ha of new and extended CNR established and operating to conserve biodiversity increasing the total area targeted by the conservation project at 225788 ha
Plants production is estimated at a total of 2181200 plants 500000 plants in 2012 632463 plants in 2013 1 048 737 plantsin 2014 and 1148 million plants in 2015 against 2 million plants planned a rate embodiment of 150 Fruit plants represent 10 of total production
On the other hand the forest inventories done show net biomass gains of 17 to 24 m3 per hectare per year Is for 225788 hectares of RNC the equivalent of an average annual reforestation effort of 21901436 plants of more than 5 cm in diameter
Add to this the fact that 28 875 ha of new RNC adds enable sequestration of nearly 57750 teq CO2 year or a 39 reduction of emission levels within ecovillages which is higher than the target which were 10
As an alternative to poaching of wildlife in APCNRs we report the following
150 units of family poultry farming with powerful breeds were provided to households and groups of women by partner NGO CIVD
8 incubators were installed for larger dissemination of poultry
700 beehives introduced into the RNC for benefit of village ecoguards

Among project sites at least 15000 ha of new and extended Community Nature Reserves established and functioning to conserve biodiversity increasing total conservation area targeted by the project to 162813 ha
Evidence of effective management is provided by increases in METT scores for all CNRs

Among the sites of the project at least 28875 ha of new and extended CNR established and operating to conserve biodiversity increasing the total area targeted by the conservation project at 225788 ha
Plants production is estimated at a total of 2181200 plants 500000 plants in 2012 632463 plants in 2013 1 048 737 plantsin 2014 and 1148 million plants in 2015 against 2 million plants planned a rate embodiment of 150 Fruit plants represent 10 of total production
On the other hand the forest inventories done show net biomass gains of 17 to 24 m3 per hectare per year Is for 225788 hectares of RNC the equivalent of an average annual reforestation effort of 21901436 plants of more than 5 cm in diameter
Add to this the fact that 28 875 ha of new RNC adds enable sequestration of nearly 57750 teq CO2 year or a 39 reduction of emission levels within ecovillages which is higher than the target which were 10
As an alternative to poaching of wildlife in APCNRs we report the following
150 units of family poultry farming with powerful breeds were provided to households and groups of women by partner NGO CIVD
8 incubators were installed for larger dissemination of poultry
700 beehives introduced into the RNC for benefit of village ecoguards

There is progress towards target achievement in 2015

description.narrative: 10 Percentage of households in project EVs with an improved cook stove

comment.narrative: Baseline for all Project villages to be established at start of implementation
At least 75 of all households in the 10 pilot Ecovillages use improved cook stoves

Target achievement is now at 92 Target was surpassed for 8 out of 10 Ecovillages but not overall
1 Lompoul 60
2 Toubel Baly 100
3 Kack 110
4 Ndick 100
5 Darsalam 100
6 Dindefelo 100
7 Massarinko100
8 Mbam 50
9 Mbackombel 100
10 Thiasky 100
Overall 92
In addition with the 900 units of improved stove of banco one can add 900 metallic improved stove installed That gives now an average of one banco stove and one metallic stovehousehold in core ecovillages and in some polarized ecovillages
We provided training and equipment to 10 teams in ecovillages for the dissemination of improved cook stoves
95 biodigesters for cooking gas and lighting kitchens installed The effluents produced are used to fertilize vegetable plots
The introduction of improved stoves and biogas in order to improve cooking methods avoided deforestation equivalent of nearly 570 ha of forest It also allowed the reduction of nearly 2 375 t eq CO2 of GHG emission
At least 75 of all households in the 10 pilot Ecovillages use improved cook stoves

description.narrative:
1 Carbon footprint using Bilan Carbone method to calculate GHG emissions sequestration from energy and land use at the level of village lands terroir villageoise
Indicator 9 below is subset of this same Indicator

comment.narrative:
Bilan Carbone baseline data exists for some test rural villages
METHODOLOGICAL NOTE added in 2013
At PRODOC preparation stage PPG the Bilan Carbone had been applied in full for 4 prospective ecovillages i Teyel in Haute Casamance ii Loumbol Samba Abdoul in the Ferlo iii Diadeum 3 in the Delta du Fleuve Sénégal and iv Massarinko in the Delta du Saloum
Of these only ii Loumbol and iv Massarinko ended up being finally selected as project sites
Through informed extrapolation and based on the results of the Bilan Carbone and other studies a proxy baseline of for the GHG balance ie emissions minus sequestration was established in for a total of 4 out of 10 project sites all of which are net emitters
Yearly GHG emission carbon sequestration balance tCO2
2 Toubel Baly 3786
4 Ndick 2973
7 Massarinko 6345
10 Thiasky 2973
PPG technical reports also showed that the most important contributors to the net emissions in prospective ecovillages were the agricultural and livestock sectors coupled with land use change

1a At start of project the baseline and businessasusual BAU development scenario for comparison will be established 10 pilot villages
1b By project end the application Bilan Carbone for 10 pilot Ecovillages shows that these villages have embarked on a low carbon development path net emissions are at least 30 lower than the BAU development scenario
NOTE on logframe revision indicator revised to introduce clarity

Good progress towards the target which are reduction of 30 of CO2 emission in ecovillages The estimation of the carbon balance in the Ecovillages is at around 148532 t CO2 eqyear
After three years the level of reduction of carbon emissions is estimated at 42566 t CO2 equivalent which corresponds to 29 reduction compared to baseline

1a At start of project the baseline and businessasusual BAU development scenario for comparison will be established 10 pilot villages
1b By project end the application Bilan Carbone for 10 pilot Ecovillages shows that these villages have embarked on a low carbon development path net emissions are at least 30 lower than the BAU development scenario
NOTE on logframe revision indicator revised to introduce clarity

Good progress towards the target which are reduction of 30 of CO2 emission in ecovillages The estimation of the carbon balance in the Ecovillages is at around 148532 t CO2 eqyear
After three years the level of reduction of carbon emissions is estimated at 42566 t CO2 equivalent which corresponds to 29 reduction compared to baseline

description.narrative: 2 Number of Environmental Management Plans EMPs adopted by pilot sites

comment.narrative: No plans are yet developed

At least 8 plans for project sites have been successfully developed and adopted endorsed by communities
At least two plans are under implementation

EMPs in the 11 core ecovillages are still under implementation
The 11 local conventions on good natural resource management developed last year are now validated and under implementation
Actions of enrichment planting in CNR are still ongoing 100000 Palmyra nuts introduced in CNR
The process of transfer of fauna is under finalization
Forest fire prevention measures are still implemented under actions such as fire breaks and forest management program 22 km of firebreaks
